summary: Implement the Proof Of Concept of Digitize Welcome Desk | Phase 01

content.text: Several David’s Bridal Store were included in an manual process to complete the proof of concept. The process includes send a message to selected customers with appointments through the Liveperson Proactive Messaging Systems and then interacting with them through the Liveperson Conversational Cloud. The only aspect of the process that cannot be emulated, without development, is the interactions between DBI and integrated systems, planned to be completed in Phase One.

wOver:
h1. Implement the Proof Of Concept of Digitize Welcome Desk | Phase 01

Several David’s Bridal Store were included in an manual process to complete the proof of concept. The process includes send a message to selected customers with appointments through the Liveperson Proactive Messaging Systems and then interacting with them through the Liveperson Conversational Cloud. The only aspect of the process that cannot be emulated, without development, is the interactions between DBI and integrated systems, planned to be completed in Phase One.

summary: Digitize Walk-In Appointments (with OOTB Timetrade Kiosk) for the Digitize Welcome Desk Project  | Phase 03

content.text: In this phase contactless check in short code for use on personal device will be piloted. This will include leveraging the out of box TimeTrade solution (kiosk site).

wOver:

content.text: In this phase myCustomers alerts on iPads for next appointment available for stylists will be introduced as well as a branded contactless check-in site and branded customer facing manager queuing system on TV screen.

summary: Automate the POC for Booked Appointments with Auto Check In Functionality for the Digitize Welcome Desk Project | Phase 02

content.text: The objective is to add interactive automation in Liveperson to the existing “Appointment Reminder Text Message” to auto-checkin an appt in Timetrade if Customer texts HERE. This will send a new Check-In Confirmation Text Message from Liveperson to the customer.

wOver:
h1. Automate the POC for Booked Appointments with Auto Check In Functionality for the Digitize Welcome Desk Project | Phase 02

The objective is to add interactive automation in Liveperson to the existing “Appointment Reminder Text Message” to auto-checkin an appt in Timetrade if Customer texts HERE. This will send a new Check-In Confirmation Text Message from Liveperson to the customer.

links.summary: There will be NO KNOWN CHANGES needed to myCustomers, myAppointments or OAV for the Appointment Confirmation and/or Appointment Reminder Text Message.
Appointment Text Message are being migrated to Proactive Message from Salesforce and will need completed prior to leveraging them for this project.

What if the appt is a no show? – Since there will be no CSR in the store, request was to automatically set an appt to a No Show 60 minutes after start of appt.Today we don’t send a text to a No Show.  Next day we send a “Sorry we missed you” email.  Poss…
What do we send Liveperson? Just phone number?  Can we use Appt Confirmation number.
What if it is a virtual appt?  How will that work?  Same as today, not included in this scope.  They will just get the existing “Virtual Appt Reminder” texts that are sent today.
What if she texts HERE twice or after we manually check her in?  Discard a check-in request for an appt already checked in
Will we have enough information from Liveperson to know which appt to check-in in Timetrade?

What if the appt is canceled after the Appt Reminder is sent?  Today we don’t send a text.  We should consider sending a Canceled Appt text that had a link to the Appt Booking BOT. NOTE:  If she had replied to the reminder text and opened a conversation,…

What if the customer does not text HERE?  How do we check her in? – Same as today, manually checkin in myAppt (but not preferred because no CSR at front)  Can we use a QR Code to send them to a microsite to check-in?

When a customer replies to an "Appointment Reminder Text Message" with the word “HERE“ the Liveperson System shall make an API call to the DBI wrapper service with the confirmation number to check the user in.

summary: Digitize Welcome Desk | DBI Chat Bot Project

content.text: As a company, David’s Bridal decided to leverage opportunities around interacting with customer appointments to help better serve her through text message communications allowing her to interact with stores about their appointments. As a company, David’s Bridal has elected to focus our

by committing to leveraging new opportunities available to us by enhancing our customers experience when it comes to Appointments. In this project teams across all practice areas are collectively leveraging Text Messaging and the interactive services available to us through our strategic partner Liveperson. Once completed customers will have the option to be reminded of their appointment, confirm their commitment to their appointment, check in when arriving at their appointment, and interact with a stylist about their appoint at the store their appointment is scheduled at. Additionally, customers with virtual appointments will be handled with the same level service less checking in for theri virtual appointment.
Experience is certain to capture more walk-ins, strengthen customer loyalty, and so much more - increase Net Promoter Score (NPS).
Pre-Appt Msg: confirm appt info, reschedule, click for directions, completing myCustomer profile, chat 1:1 with store; Appt Status Msg: check-in via text, notification when stylist is available
: Check-in: customers with an appt can quickly let us know she’s here; Walk-in: capture walk-in customer’s information digitally
Open availability view*, Approximate wait times*, Virtual queue, Notify stylist when appt arrives*

wOver:
h1. Digitize Welcome Desk | DBI Chat Bot Project

As a company, David’s Bridal decided to leverage opportunities around interacting with customer appointments to help better serve her through text message communications allowing her to interact with stores about their appointments. As a company, David’s Bridal has elected to focus our Continuous Improvement Effort by committing to leveraging new opportunities available to us by enhancing our customers experience when it comes to Appointments. In this project teams across all practice areas are collectively leveraging Text Messaging and the interactive services available to us through our strategic partner Liveperson. Once completed customers will have the option to be reminded of their appointment, confirm their commitment to their appointment, check in when arriving at their appointment, and interact with a stylist about their appoint at the store their appointment is scheduled at. Additionally, customers with virtual appointments will be handled with the same level service less checking in for theri virtual appointment.

Digitizing Welcome Desk Experience is certain to capture more walk-ins, strengthen customer loyalty, and so much more - increase Net Promoter Score (NPS).

  • ChatBot: Pre-Appt Msg: confirm appt info, reschedule, click for directions, completing myCustomer profile, chat 1:1 with store; Appt Status Msg: check-in via text, notification when stylist is available
  • Kiosk: Check-in: customers with an appt can quickly let us know she’s here; Walk-in: capture walk-in customer’s information digitally
  • Streamline Process: Open availability view*, Approximate wait times*, Virtual queue, Notify stylist when appt arrives*
